turns.speaker: KURTZ
turns.text: ...the best way one can, you know.

turns.speaker: MARTINS
turns.text: What's the name of this girl?

turns.speaker: KURTZ
turns.text: Yes. The man who helped carry him.

turns.speaker: MARTINS
turns.text: All right - I'm mad. I've seen a ghost...

turns.speaker: MARTINS
turns.text: Vinkel...You've got quite a collection of er-collection.

turns.speaker: WINKEL
turns.text: I can tell you very little. He was run over by a car. He was dead when I arrived.

turns.speaker: MARTINS
turns.text: Could he have been at all conscious?

turns.speaker: WINKEL
turns.text: ...he was. Yes, for a short time, while they carried him across the road.

turns.speaker: MARTINS
turns.text: Did you know Mr. Lime well?

turns.speaker: PORTER
turns.text: und ich kann nicht alle kennen.

turns.speaker: PORTER
turns.text: Sehen sie da gleich da unter. Da unten ist est passiert. Passiert - English.

turns.speaker: PORTER
turns.text: Not saw, heard...heard. I heard the brakes. Wham! And I got to the window and saw them carry the body to the other side of the er...er Joseph...that's Joseph Emperor Joseph Statue.

turns.speaker: MARTINS
turns.text: Why didn't they bring him in the house?

turns.speaker: PORTER
turns.text: Conscious? Cas soll ich auch noch wissen?

turns.speaker: MARTINS
turns.text: Oh, er - oh...was he - was he still alive?

turns.speaker: PORTER
turns.text: Er, alive? He couldn't have been alive, not with his head in the way it was.

turns.speaker: MARTINS
turns.text: I was told that he did not die at once.

turns.speaker: PORTER
turns.text: Ah, er war gleich tot - I mean, sie war gleich tot - brauchen kein angst zu. Ein moment...Wart ein bissel...Wartein bissel. Fraulein Schmidt!

turns.speaker: PORTER
turns.text: There was a third man - he didn't give evidence.

turns.speaker: PORTER
turns.text: No, no. He came late after they carried him to the Joseph Statue.

turns.speaker: MARTINS
turns.text: You gotta tell your story to the police.

turns.speaker: PORTER
turns.text: Police? Why police? Das ist alles blodsum was sie da sangen. No, no. It is all nonsense; it was an accident.

turns.speaker: MARTINS
turns.text: You don't know it was an accident. You only saw a dead man and three men carry him.

turns.speaker: PORTER
turns.text: Der ami macht mich noch ganz deppert. I should have listened to my wife. She said you were up to no good. Gossip.

turns.speaker: PORTER
turns.text: Fer von mir aus gehen sie zur gansalt aber mich lassen sie aus mit der politzei.

turns.speaker: PORTER
turns.text: Das hat man davon wenn man freundlich ist mit den auslandern...

turns.speaker: PORTER
turns.text: I have no evidence. I saw nothing. I said nothing. It's not my business.

turns.speaker: PORTER
turns.text: I am not a bad man.

turns.speaker: POPESCU
turns.text: Not the sort of thing I should confess to a total stranger, but you have to break the rules sometimes. Humanity's duty.

turns.speaker: POPESCU
turns.text: Two double whiskeys. Was wunschen sie?

turns.speaker: MARTINS
turns.text: I thought there was something funny about the whole thing.

turns.speaker: POPESCU
turns.text: Of course there was. Some ice for Mr. Martins.

turns.speaker: POPESCU
turns.text: Wasn't he at the police inquiry?

turns.speaker: MARTINS
turns.text: He didn't want to get involved.

turns.speaker: POPESCU
turns.text: Will we never teach these Austrians to be good citizens. It was his duty to give the evidence.

turns.speaker: POPESCU
turns.text: What else did he tell you?

turns.speaker: MARTINS
turns.text: That Harry was dead before you got him to that statue.

turns.speaker: MARTINS
turns.text: He probably knows a lot more than that. Somebody's lying.

turns.speaker: MARTINS
turns.text: Should I make it all fact?

turns.speaker: U.S.M.P.
turns.text: What's the purpose of your visit here?

turns.speaker: MARTINS
turns.text: A friend of mine offered me a job here.

turns.speaker: MARTINS
turns.text: I thought he'd be here to meet me.

turns.speaker: DAFFY
turns.text: Look, I'm sorry to bother you but I was wondering if you could help me out.

turns.speaker: DAFFY
turns.text: Yeah; just ten or fifteen dollars maybe.

turns.speaker: RICHARD
turns.text: I'm sorry, I don't think so.

turns.speaker: DAFFY
turns.text: I'm waiting on some money coming through. It's just that at the moment, you know, I'm short. They're going to chuck me out. On the street in Bangkok, that's bad.

turns.speaker: RICHARD
turns.text: I'm really sorry but I just arrived; I'm on a pretty tight budget myself. I just can't afford it.

turns.speaker: RICHARD
turns.text: I'm sorry. I can't lend you any money.

turns.speaker: DAFFY
turns.text: If you could see your way to lending me some cash -

turns.speaker: DAFFY
turns.text: Thank you, sir. Thank you. I promise I will repay you.

turns.speaker: DAFFY
turns.text: You. You're the guy that lent me the money.

turns.speaker: RICHARD
turns.text: Yeah, that's right. Now could you be quiet so I can get some sleep.

turns.speaker: DAFFY
turns.text: Ten dollars. I'll find a way to pay you back. How would you like to know About somewhere special? The perfect beach. Paradise. No one else knows about it. That's got to be worth something. What do you say?

turns.speaker: RICHARD
turns.text: Look I don't care about the money right now: I just want some sleep. So if you could be quiet -

turns.speaker: DAFFY
turns.text: Yea, OK. I will be, I will be, I promise.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE
turns.text: What are you doing in Thailand? Tourist?

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE
turns.text: You go to Patpong? See smoke from pussy, ping pong ball from pussy, razor blade from pussy; bird from pussy.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE
turns.text: Why not? Thai girls best in the world. Thai food best in the world. Thai dope best in the world.

turns.speaker: RICHARD
turns.text: I wouldn't know anything about that, sir.

turns.speaker: RICHARD
turns.text: The noise? Don't worry. You're on holiday.

turns.speaker: ETIENNE
turns.text: She means your neighbor. The Scotsman

turns.speaker: RICHARD
turns.text: Oh, that noise! Yes, he certainly did.

turns.speaker: ETIENNE
turns.text: We moved rooms because of him.

turns.speaker: RICHARD
turns.text: It would be nice though, if there was a place like that. You know, that no one could get to.

turns.speaker: ETIENNE
turns.text: Of course, but look; all these people. If that place existed, they'd all be there.

turns.speaker: ETIENNE
turns.text: It's arranged. Tomorrow morning. Eight hundred bath.

turns.speaker: ETIENNE
turns.text: He will not take us to the island. It's in the National Park and it is forbidden to go there. But we are allowed to travel to this one to stay for one night.

turns.speaker: RICHARD
turns.text: Yes, of course I can swim. How far do you think it is?

turns.speaker: RICHARD
turns.text: Oh. Great. Not far at all. I don't like to be negative, but do you think we should let someone know where we're going?

turns.speaker: RICHARD
turns.text: We're going to swim "one or two kilometers" across open sea, from one uninhabited island to another. Something goes wrong. What then?

turns.speaker: ETIENNE
turns.text: Richard, it's secret. That's the whole point.

turns.speaker: RICHARD
turns.text: Yeah, OK. Forget it. We won't tell anyone.

turns.speaker: RICHARD
turns.text: We think in miles, not kilometers.

turns.speaker: ETIENNE
turns.text: So how many miles do you think it is?

turns.speaker: RICHARD
turns.text: I have no idea but it looks like a long way.

turns.speaker: RICHARD
turns.text: I think we're about half way.

turns.speaker: ETIENNE
turns.text: I don't know, just a fin. Over there. About a hundred meters.

turns.speaker: RICHARD
turns.text: Well what the fuck do you expect me to do about it.

turns.speaker: ETIENNE
turns.text: Nothing. I just thought you ought to know.

turns.speaker: RICHARD
turns.text: Well to be honest, Etienne, I would rather have not known about it.

turns.speaker: ETIENNE
turns.text: She just went under the water. She was pulled under. Oh God, I don't see her.

turns.speaker: RICHARD
turns.text: Was there a shark? Did you see a shark?

turns.speaker: FRANCOISE
turns.text: He tried to borrow money from us.

turns.speaker: ETIENNE
turns.text: What idiot would lend him money? It would disappear.

turns.speaker: FRANCOISE
turns.text: He said if we lent him money h would tell us about a secret beach.

turns.speaker: ETIENNE
turns.text: It's on an island that no one get to.

turns.speaker: FRANCOISE
turns.text: But he has been there, off course.

turns.speaker: ETIENNE
turns.text: It was ridiculous; all this at three o'clock in the morning.

turns.speaker: ETIENNE
turns.text: We leave our rucksacks on this island and then we swim.

turns.speaker: FRANCOISE
turns.text: I hope our noise did not keep you awake.

turns.speaker: RICHARD
turns.text: Hi there. Here, take a look.

turns.speaker: FRANCOISE
turns.text: I think it's a bad idea to tell anyone.

turns.speaker: FRANCOISE
turns.text: Sshh. Etienne will be angry if I wake him. He thinks I waste film taking photographs of the sky.

turns.speaker: FRANCOISE
turns.text: One night I will get the perfect photograph.

turns.speaker: RICHARD
turns.text: You realize that in the eternity of space, there is a planet, just like this one, where you are photographing back towards us. You're photographing yourself.

turns.speaker: RICHARD
turns.text: There are infinite worlds out there, where anything that can happen does happen.

turns.speaker: FRANCOISE
turns.text: So on one you are rich, on another poor. On one you are a murderer, on another the victim.

turns.speaker: FRANCOISE
turns.text: That is just the kind of pretentious bullshit that Englishmen and Americans always say to French girls so that they can sleep with them.

turns.speaker: RICHARD
turns.text: Sorry. I thought I was doing quite well.

turns.speaker: RICHARD
turns.text: If it's too far, then we'll drown. But if we dont try then we'll never know.

turns.speaker: SAMMY
turns.text: Do you know the Kentucky friend mouse story?"

turns.speaker: RICHARD
turns.text: Woman bites chicken leg, turns out to be a mouse. Or a rat. It's an urban myth.

turns.speaker: SAMMY
turns.text: Exactly. Always happened to someone else.

turns.speaker: SAMMY
turns.text: So there's an urban myth, well more of a rural myth, going around here at the moment. It's about a beach.

turns.speaker: RAV ZINGESSER
turns.text: But, Danny, if HaShem is everything, and we are nothing how are we to judge His actions?

turns.speaker: 12-YEAR-OLD DANNY
turns.text: We have free will and intelligence -- which God allegedly gave us....

turns.speaker: 12-YEAR-OLD DANNY
turns.text: There's midrash supporting this. My father read a book by Shalom Spiegel that -- Isaac actually died and was reborn.

turns.speaker: 12-YEAR-OLD DANNY
turns.text: I do; I follow it. But okay, say God provided the ram. So what? Once Abraham raised the knife, in his heart it was as if he'd killed him. He could never forget that. And neither could Isaac. Look at him: he's traumatized, he's a putz for the rest of his life. By the end he can't tell Jacob from Esau....

turns.speaker: 12-YEAR-OLD DANNY
turns.text: I think the whole Jewish people were permanently scarred by what happened on Mt. Moriah, and we still live in terror....

turns.speaker: RAV ZINGESSER
turns.text: And you, if you had come out of Egypt, you would have been destroyed in the desert with those who worshipped the Golden Calf.

turns.speaker: 12-YEAR-OLD DANNY
turns.text: Then let Him destroy me now. Let Him crush me like the conceited bully He is.  Go ahead. Kill me. Here I am. Do it!!

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: They only kill them when they love them?

turns.speaker: AVI
turns.text: What are you doing here, I thought you were a Nazi.

turns.speaker: AVI
turns.text: I rest my case. He's a Jewish Nazi. He always was.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: They're racist, they're militaristic, they act like bullyboys in the territories....

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Read the early Zionists on European Jewry; they sound like Goebbels.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: The Nazis did everything the führer told them. You do everything the Torah tells you. Or the rebbe. Identical slave mentality.

turns.speaker: BILLINGS
turns.text: ...So she takes the pants in back -- where they try them on? And I think fuck it....

turns.speaker: CARLETON
turns.text: Are you shitting me?? Right in the store?

turns.speaker: BILLINGS
turns.text: She's been giving me the eye. She's hot. So I wait till the owner goes up front....

turns.speaker: CARLETON
turns.text: Didn't you see Raiders of the Lost Ark?

turns.speaker: CARLETON
turns.text: That was an ark, man. That was a Torah. They fucked around with it, and the Torah melted their faces.

turns.speaker: CARLETON
turns.text: Fine, go ahead. Touch the letters.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: What do you think you're doing?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Who am I?? Who are you, you schmucks, you can't even make a decent swastika.... Give me the paint.  Give it to me.

turns.speaker: BILLINGS
turns.text: Bring your friends.... We're not his friends.

turns.speaker: BILLINGS
turns.text: What, do you like it here?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Read Mein Kampf? Hitler had all his best ideas in prison.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: We'll go to the country sometime, okay?

turns.speaker: BILLINGS
turns.text: Do we have to listen to this shit?

turns.speaker: BILLINGS
turns.text: Why'd we have to leave so fast?

turns.speaker: BILLINGS
turns.text: Danny, it's true. There were no six million. At most, two hundred thousand Jews died in the camps. And the majority of them were from disease and --

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Where did you read this? Robert Faurisson?

turns.speaker: BILLINGS
turns.text: Yeah. He's a respected scholar. Even No-am Chomsky says he --

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Billings, if Hitler didn't kill six million, why is he your hero?... Concentration camps all over Europe, and he only gets rid of a measly two hundred thousand.... He's a putz.

turns.speaker: BILLINGS
turns.text: Let's look at the fucking thing.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: It's called the flame alphabet. It's supposed to be the word of God written in fire.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: The mystics tried to read the white spaces around the letters. They thought there was a whole alternative language hidden there, with secret, alternative meanings.

turns.speaker: BILLINGS
turns.text: How come you know all this shit?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: How come you don't know it?  How can you say you hate the Jews when you don't know anything about --

turns.speaker: BILLINGS
turns.text: Fuck you. I hate the Jews at least as much as you do.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: No, you don't.... If you hated them, you'd study them, so you'd know why you hate them. You know what tefillin is? Tsitsis? Shotness? You know the kaddish from the kiddush?  Eichmann? He went to Israel. He studied the Torah, the Talmud, the Mishnah, the whole bit. He hated Jews.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Yeah, but not on the letters.

turns.speaker: BRAND
turns.text: You write that?  Come work for me. You've got a lot to learn; I can teach it to you.

turns.speaker: BRAND
turns.text: This? This is a joke.  I'll give your group a thousand bucks.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: You gave fifty thousand to that college magazine.

turns.speaker: BRAND
turns.text: Fifty's an exaggeration. Anyway, that was a different moment. Things were possible that aren't now.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Actually, I think this moment has possibilities that --

turns.speaker: BRAND
turns.text: Yeah, I read your piece. It's very smart. And very wrong.
